required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Facial Lacerations Repaired With Dermabond Compared With Dermabond With Underlying Steristrips in Pediatric Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Cosmetic Outcomes of Simple Facial Lacerations Repaired With Dermabond Compared With Dermabond With Underlying Steristrips: A Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to compare cosmetic outcomes of simple facial lacerations in children repaired with Dermabond (skin glue) compared with Dermabond (skin glue) with underlying steristrips (skin adhesive strips).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Experimental group: Dermabond with underlying steristrips. Control group: Dermabond alone

primary_outcome.description: cosmetic scar outcome; photo will be taken of scar at 2 months and graded using a visual analog scale (VAS) by blinded reviewers. The VAS is a 0-100mm standardized scale where 0mm represents the "worst scar" and 100mm represents the "best scar" and reviewers will place a marking along the line of where they feel the scar belongs.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (physician will complete just after the repair)
secondary_outcome.description: A stopwatch will be used to time how long it takes the physician to repair the wound

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (physician will complete just after the repair)
secondary_outcome.description: Physicians will complete a VAS (visual analog scale) on how easy the laceration was to repair. The VAS is a 0-100mm scale where 0 will represent "very easy" and 100mm will represent "very difficult" to repair and the physician will mark along the scale.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (physician will complete just after the repair)
secondary_outcome.description: Physician will write down what types of analgesia they used and whether or not sedation was used after the repair is complete
Families will get a phone call at 1 week to discuss if this has occurred. The electronic medical record will also be reviewed.
Families will get a phone call at 1 week to discuss if this has occurred. The electronic medical record will also be reviewed.

intervention.description: Laceration repaired with Dermabond with underlying steristrips

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age â‰¤17 years old
- Presents with simple, linear facial laceration requiring repair
- English or Spanish speaking parents or guardians
Exclusion Criteria:
- Laceration to lips, nose, ear, eyelids, eyebrows
- Laceration requiring multi-layer closure
- Laceration requiring sub-specialty care
- Laceration that has previously been repaired
- Animal/human bites
- Lacerations >5cm in length
- Allergy to adhesive
